name: Enhanced geothermal systems
sector: Supply,Energy transformation,Power,Generation,Geothermal,Enhanced geothermal systems
description: Enhanced or engineered geothermal systems aim at using the heat of the Earth where no or insufficient steam or hot water exists and where permeability is low. EGS technology is centred on engineering and creating large heat exchange areas in hot rock. The process involves enhancing permeability by opening pre-existing fractures and/or creating new fractures. Heat is extracted by pumping a transfer medium, typically water, down a borehole into the hot fractured rock and then pumping the heated fluid up another borehole to a power plant, from where it is pumped back down (recirculated) to repeat the cycle. There were significant developments in 2024, predominantly by Fervo and their PPA with Google, but Sage also made some progress with securing 100% offtake with Meta.
NZErationale: Opens the opportunity to use a much larger fraction of thermal energy, but there is uncertainty on future costs.

name: Building design tools
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Building design tools
description: Design tools to support building designers in estimating the combined impact of the different technologies during the design phase of a new building or of a building renovation. Such tools allow management of a greater number of alternatives in finding optimal design solutions.
NZErationale: Necessary to combine technologies to maximise the performance of the building.
text: Design tools to support building designers in estimating the combined impact of the different technologies during the design phase of a new building or of a building renovation. Such tools allow management of a greater number of alternatives in finding optimal design solutions. Necessary to combine technologies to maximise the performance of the building.

name: Building inspection tools
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Building inspection tools
description: Immersive technologies for buildings enabling remote, real-time inspections of 3D virtual replicas of construction sites
NZErationale: Eliminates travel needs for buildings inspections
text: Immersive technologies for buildings enabling remote, real-time inspections of 3D virtual replicas of construction sites Eliminates travel needs for buildings inspections

name: Building integrated photovoltaic systems
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Electricity generation,Building integrated photovoltaic systems
description: Photovoltaic systems (e.g. panels, cells or any other product) are integrated in the building skin. Two technologies are in competition: thick crystal products (made from crystalline silicon) and thin-film products (where an active photovoltaic material is placed on a glass or metal substrate).
NZErationale: High electricity generation potential and high cost-competitiveness under PV-friendly regulations. In the Net Zero Emissions by 2050 Scenario, solar PV and wind supply about 40% of building electricity use by 2030.

name: Building orientation for lighting performance
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Lighting performance,Building orientation for lighting performance
description: Attention to building design to maximise daylight in the building through, for example, window placement, light shelves, shorter partitions.
NZErationale: Maximisation of daylight, increased visual comfort.
text: Attention to building design to maximise daylight in the building through, for example, window placement, light shelves, shorter partitions. Maximisation of daylight, increased visual comfort.

name: Fibre-optic daylighting
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Lighting performance,Fibre-optic daylighting
description: Fibre optics combined with solar light collectors to transmit daylight in zones usually hard to light in the day, also called "remote source lighting".
NZErationale: Exploitation of daylight.
text: Fibre optics combined with solar light collectors to transmit daylight in zones usually hard to light in the day, also called "remote source lighting". Exploitation of daylight.

name: Extended building materials lifetime
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Material efficiency,Extended building materials lifetime
description: Modular building components include re-configurable systems, and overall systems, networks and designs that allow disassembly so that buildings can meet different needs (e.g. serving as a meeting room, conference room, co-working space, etc) or even be used for different functions (e.g. office space, residential use, etc).
NZErationale: Lifetime extension is the primary source of material savings in the Net Zero Emissions by 2050 Scenario, and making buildings flexible is key to extending their lifespans.
text: Modular building components include re-configurable systems, and overall systems, networks and designs that allow disassembly so that buildings can meet different needs (e.g. serving as a meeting room, conference room, co-working space, etc) or even be used for different functions (e.g. office space, residential use, etc). Lifetime extension is the primary source of material savings in the Net Zero Emissions by 2050 Scenario, and making buildings flexible is key to extending their lifespans.

name: Composite construction
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Material efficiency,Lightweighting,Composite construction
description: Composite construction uses a combination of two or more materials used together in the main structural elements. Examples include buildings which utilise: steel columns with a floor system of reinforced concrete beams; a steel frame system with a concrete core; concrete-encased steel columns; concrete-filled steel tubes; a timber frame with a concrete core, etc.
NZErationale: Composite construction is already dominating the high-rise construction market, and gaining market shares every year.
text: Composite construction uses a combination of two or more materials used together in the main structural elements. Examples include buildings which utilise: steel columns with a floor system of reinforced concrete beams; a steel frame system with a concrete core; concrete-encased steel columns; concrete-filled steel tubes; a timber frame with a concrete core, etc. Composite construction is already dominating the high-rise construction market, and gaining market shares every year.

name: Composite materials
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Material efficiency,Lightweighting,Composite materials
description: Composite materials consist of two or more chemically distinct constituents on a macro-scale with properties which cannot be obtained by any constituent working individually. They may include materials reinforced with fibres, flakes, particulates, or laminated composites, etc.
NZErationale: The association of several structural materials enhances material quality and allows to use fewer carbon-intensive structural elements within the building.
text: Composite materials consist of two or more chemically distinct constituents on a macro-scale with properties which cannot be obtained by any constituent working individually. They may include materials reinforced with fibres, flakes, particulates, or laminated composites, etc. The association of several structural materials enhances material quality and allows to use fewer carbon-intensive structural elements within the building.

name: Funicular floor system
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Material efficiency,Lightweighting,Funicular floor system
description: The funicular floor is a thin concrete element consisting of vaults and optimised stiffening fins. The thickness of the slab and fins is no more than 20 mm, which allows 70% of the concrete to be replaced by low-density insulation materials to improve the thermal performance of the floor.
NZErationale: The funicular floor system uses (on-average) 70% less concrete than a traditional slab and uses no reinforcement. It also has better environmental performance.

name: Thin shelled concrete
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Material efficiency,Lightweighting,Thin shelled concrete
description: A thin shelled concrete roof is a sandwich structure integrating buildings elements (e.g. a hydronic radiant heating and cooling system, thin film photovoltaic systems, etc.) while also serving as a lightweighted roof. The thickness of the concrete varies between 3 and 30 cm, and it withstands stress thanks to its specific shape.
NZErationale: More sustainable material compared to plywood.
text: A thin shelled concrete roof is a sandwich structure integrating buildings elements (e.g. a hydronic radiant heating and cooling system, thin film photovoltaic systems, etc.) while also serving as a lightweighted roof. name: Additive manufacturing for building materials
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Material efficiency,Reducing material losses,Additive manufacturing for building materials
description: The introduction of additive manufacturing (or 3D printing) in the precast concrete industry appears to be a viable solution for high repeatability over many concrete pours. 3D printing can be applied directly to the on-site construction process, reducing the environmental impact while exploring new and complicated geometries.
NZErationale: 3D printing could reduce costs related to raw materials and to labour, while being an effective material efficiency strategy (by cutting material demand by 50%).

name: Fabric formwork
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Material efficiency,Reducing material losses,Fabric formwork
description: Fabric formwork allows the design of concrete elements in a flexible way, using a soft formwork than can be shaped according to an optimised layout. It can be used for walls, columns, and elevated slab soffits (an exterior or interior architectural feature, generally the horizontal, aloft underside of any construction element).
NZErationale: Fabric formwork saves on average 35% of concrete compared to conventional rigid wood or steel panel formwork, but is applied in locations where site logistics might be prohibitive or experienced labour less locally available.
text: Fabric formwork allows the design of concrete elements in a flexible way, using a soft formwork than can be shaped according to an optimised layout. name: Pre-casting
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Material efficiency,Reducing material losses,Pre-casting
description: Precasting is the use of a reusable mould to produce a structural element in a controlled and standardised environment. The precast is then transported to the construction site to be assembled with other structural pieces.
NZErationale: The use of precast concrete parts in the building sector is a practical method to create modular structure at a lower cost, allowing for a wide variety of shapes and designs. This solution could provide efficiency in the use of material, allowing for reduced material use, and also improve construction and operation efficiency. Good material properties, such as thermal insulation and weather resistance, and the possibility to recycle it make the precast concrete a key factor in the development of the building sector.

name: Prefabrication
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Material efficiency,Reducing material losses,Prefabrication
description: Prefabrication refers to the assembly of structural building components in a controlled environment outside of the construction site. The assembled structure is then transported on site to be finalised.
NZErationale: Reduction of material demand and related energy expenses.
text: Prefabrication refers to the assembly of structural building components in a controlled environment outside of the construction site. The assembled structure is then transported on site to be finalised. Reduction of material demand and related energy expenses.

sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Fenestration,Dynamic glazing – thermochromic fenestration
description: Passive modification of properties in terms of thermal transmittance, solar heat gains coefficient and visible transmittance due to a change in temperature.
NZErationale: Lower cost compared to electrochromic but lower controllability and versatility.

description: Window able to change transmittance, solar heat gain coefficient and visible transmittance, energised by electrical current.

name: Highly insulating window
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Fenestration,Highly insulating window
description: Window with R-values of R-5/7 achievable thanks to low emissivity coating, multi-panel, well insulated and sealed glazing assemblies, and low conductivity frames.
NZErationale: Broad applicability, high energy savings and improved comfort.

sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Fenestration,Insulation glass coating
description: Low emissivity film directly applied in the interior side of windows or to the external window frame to allow or prevent heat gains depending on building energy needs.
NZErationale: Broad applicability, cost competitive when mature, and provides improved comfort.
text: Low emissivity film directly applied in the interior side of windows or to the external window frame to allow or prevent heat gains depending on building energy needs. Broad applicability, cost competitive when mature, and provides improved comfort.

name: Aerogel insulation from silica or carbon
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Aerogel insulation from silica or carbon
description: Insulation made with synthetic porous material in which the liquid component of the gel is replaced with gas (aerogel). They can also be used as transparent insulation materials.
NZErationale: Energy savings associated with the very low thermal conductivity of the material.
text: Insulation made with synthetic porous material in which the liquid component of the gel is replaced with gas (aerogel). They can also be used as transparent insulation materials. Energy savings associated with the very low thermal conductivity of the material.

name: Air sealing
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Air sealing
description:
Systematic sealing of air leakages throughout the building surface (and particularly around cracks, small holes, plumbing, wiring, lighting and ductwork) to reduce heat loss and better control humidity. This needs to be coupled with appropriate ventilation.
Technologies: foam, caulk, tape or gaskets.
NZErationale: High energy savings potential at low cost, improved comfort, improved indoor air quality (reduced humidity, dust, pollen, etc) and increased durability (avoided moisture and condensation).

name: Building integrated heat and moisture exchange panel
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Building integrated heat and moisture exchange panel
description: Achieving a thermal and humidity transfer in heat recovery ventilators by preconditioning the ventilation air in a modular system (while state-of-the art energy recovery ventilators offer low humidity exchange).
NZErationale: Combines benefits of energy savings from ventilation and increased insulation.
text: Achieving a thermal and humidity transfer in heat recovery ventilators by preconditioning the ventilation air in a modular system (while state-of-the art energy recovery ventilators offer low humidity exchange). Combines benefits of energy savings from ventilation and increased insulation.

name: Building integrated phase change materials
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Building integrated phase change materials
description:
Phase-change materials provide latent heat storage (i.e. at a constant temperature, by changing the material's phase) and are integrated into different building components. They enhance the building's thermal performance as heat losses are reduced.
Integration: in concrete, glazing, between structural elements, using insulation wallboards or even combined with building-integrated photovoltaic (BIPV).
NZErationale: The integration of phase-change materials enables greater compactness, a reduction in total system costs (through packaging) and the exploitation of synergies from the various functionalities of building components. Today, costs are still prohibitive of greater market uptake.

name: Building integrated solar thermal collector (BIST)
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Building integrated solar thermal collector (BIST)
description: Multi-functional energy facade that receives the solar irradiation and converts it into heat energy for the heating/cooling circuits.
NZErationale: Solar thermal technologies deployed in around 400 million dwellings by 2030 in the Net Zero Emissions by 2050 Scenario.  Packaged solutions are needed to bring down costs, enhance efficiency and improve aesthetics for new houses.

sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Double skin facade
description: Multiple layers of air and glazing where the air cavity is ventilated (naturally or mechanically).
NZErationale: Lower energy demand thanks to increased insulation, ventilation, control of solar heat gains and daylight.
text: Multiple layers of air and glazing where the air cavity is ventilated (naturally or mechanically). Lower energy demand thanks to increased insulation, ventilation, control of solar heat gains and daylight.

name: Dynamic building envelope
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Dynamic building envelope
description: Changing envelope functionality in response to the variation of climate conditions and occupant behaviour, using controllable thermal mass, ventilation, shading, heat exchanges, humidity control, etc.
NZErationale: Increased building flexibility and resilience, maximisation of renewable energy savings exploitation, energy savings.
text: Changing envelope functionality in response to the variation of climate conditions and occupant behaviour, using controllable thermal mass, ventilation, shading, heat exchanges, humidity control, etc. Increased building flexibility and resilience, maximisation of renewable energy savings exploitation, energy savings.

name: High reflectivity paint
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,High reflectivity paint
description: Paints that provide the same visible colour range as standard products but exploit the infra-red spectrum to reflect a greater part of the solar irradiation spectrum.
NZErationale: Reduced demand for space cooling, broad applicability.

sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Radiative reflective roof

sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Structural insulated panel

NZErationale: Rapid construction, reduced dependence on framing contractors, high performance and no thermal bridges.

name: Transpired solar heat collectors
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Transpired solar heat collectors
description: Perforated wall panel that draws the air heated by the sun through perforations into a cavity. Heat calories are then driven into the building's ventilation system during cold days, and ejected directly into the atmosphere during warm days.
NZErationale: Reduction of heating demand in commercial buildings, in particular by maximising heat gains: it converts up to 80% of the sun’s radiation into warm air.

name: Trombe wall
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Trombe wall
description: Storage and solar heating walls in components with high thermal mass which leads to indirect heat gains. They encompass a range of designs including classic, composite, water, solar trans-wall, fluidised and photovoltaic.
NZErationale: Simple configuration, high energy savings, cost-competitive when mature.

name: Vacuum insulated panel
sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Vacuum insulated panel
description: Porous core enclosed by an air-sealed air and vapour barrier that reduces heat conductivity and component thickness.
NZErationale: The thermal resistance of vacuum insulated panels is 5 to 10 times greater compared to other insulation materials at the same level of thickness.
text: Porous core enclosed by an air-sealed air and vapour barrier that reduces heat conductivity and component thickness. The thermal resistance of vacuum insulated panels is 5 to 10 times greater compared to other insulation materials at the same level of thickness.

sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building envelope,Wall, roof & façade,Vapour permeable walls

sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Building orientation for thermal performance

sector: Demand,Buildings,Buildings construction and renovation,Thermal performance,Ventilation,Natural ventilation

NZErationale: Compared to traditional food stoves, biogas reduces carbon emissions, and compared to use of solid fuels, improves indoor air quality. Light bag stoves may have lower costs compared to other digesters.

name: Programmable thermostat
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Control systems,Programmable thermostat
description: Programmable thermostat allowing full control schedules for HVAC operation, based on the user's climate control preferences. A smart thermostat goes far beyond relying on a simple schedule that traditional thermostats might rely on, and can include self-learning algorithms, predictive building controls, occupant level controls, and thermal zoning.
NZErationale: Smart thermostats can reduce heating and cooling demand by 20% to 40% depending on building needs and climate conditions, but could also increase energy use from the rebound effect of the multiple services it can provide.

name: Heat exchanger
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Distribution,Heat exchanger
description: Advanced heat exchangers for building-level substations.
NZErationale: New plate design can reduce pressure loss by 35% and improve the heat transfer by 10%.

name: Proportional hydraulic control
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Distribution,Proportional hydraulic control
description: Interface between a central boiler or district heat circuit and the heating and hot water system of individual apartments, which also deliver temperature control to the building occupants by hydraulic control providing a more stable temperature compared to thermostatic control.
NZErationale: Diffusion is dependent on the distribution of centralised heating systems; provides more stable temperature control when compared to traditional systems.
text: Interface between a central boiler or district heat circuit and the heating and hot water system of individual apartments, which also deliver temperature control to the building occupants by hydraulic control providing a more stable temperature compared to thermostatic control. name: Water heating heat pump booster
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Distribution,Water heating heat pump booster
description: Heat pumps to supply domestic hot water in district heating systems, allowing district heating temperatures below those required for domestic hot water. District heat water is used as heat source for the heat pump boosters.
NZErationale: Booster heat pumps enable district heating networks to operate at lower temperatures and reduce heat losses compared to networks based on central heat pumps only, improving the coefficient of performance of the central heat pumps.

name: Hydrogen boiler
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Boilers,Hydrogen boiler
description: Boilers using hydrogen as a fuel instead of natural gas.
NZErationale: Despite a relatively low deployment in the Net Zero Emissions by 2050 Scenario, hydrogen boilers provide a heating solution for buildings connected to a 100% hydrogen network.

sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Cogeneration,Fuel cell micro-CHP using polymer electrolyte membrane
description: Electrochemical device operating at temperatures up to 80 °C. Requires a back-up option for peak heat demand. Load following modulation.
NZErationale: High electrical (48-66%) and total efficiency, no emission of pollutants into the atmosphere. Cogeneration

name: Fuel cell micro-CHP using solid oxide materials
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Cogeneration,Fuel cell micro-CHP using solid oxide materials
description: Electrochemical device operating at a high temperature (600-850 °C), converting the chemical energy of a fuel directly to electrical energy. Requires a back-up option for peak heat demand. Day-night modulation.
NZErationale: High electrical (30-59%) and total efficiency, no emission of pollutants into the atmosphere. Cogeneration.

name: Evaporative cooling coupled with permeable membrane
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Evaporative Cooling,Evaporative cooling coupled with permeable membrane
description: Membrane and evaporative cooling as alternative to vapour compression technologies. Independent control of dry bulb temperature and humidity. The membrane acts as barrier to separate moisture from air.
NZErationale: Independent temperature and humidity control, higher efficiency compared to vapour compression cycles. No refrigerants. Compact units.
text: Membrane and evaporative cooling as alternative to vapour compression technologies. Independent control of dry bulb temperature and humidity. The membrane acts as barrier to separate moisture from air. Independent temperature and humidity control, higher efficiency compared to vapour compression cycles. No refrigerants. Compact units.

name: Liquid or solid desiccant evaporative cooling system
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Evaporative Cooling,Liquid or solid desiccant evaporative cooling system
description: Combination of evaporative and desiccant cooling. Independent control of temperature and humidity. The liquid desiccant, or the rotary wheel in case of solid desiccant, absorbs water vapour due to the difference between the partial vapour pressure of the desiccant and the ambient. Operated by both thermal and electric energy. They can be coupled with membrane to avoid the risk of desiccant contamination.
NZErationale: Independent temperature and humidity control. Expected to reduce consumption by 30-90%  (and 80% peak energy) compared to state-of-art most efficient cooling technologies. No refrigerants. Deployment is limited to places with low heating and hot water demand (otherwise a net-zero emissions household would need a reversible unit).

name: State-of-the-art evaporative technology
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Evaporative Cooling,State-of-the-art evaporative technology
description: Converts sensible heat to enthalpy of vapour for reducing the system temperature. It can be air-mediated or water-mediated and direct or indirect.
NZErationale: Energy and cost savings. No refrigerants. Deployment is limited to places with low heating and hot water demand (otherwise a net-zero emissions household would need a reversible unit).

name: Air-source heat pump using heat recovery
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Air‐to‐air heat pump,Air-source heat pump using heat recovery
description:
Air-source heat pump using heat recovery either:
1. In cooling mode, as the exhaust air from air conditioners can be recycled and used to deliver other energy services, such as water heating.
2. In heating mode, as the exhaust heat can be recovered through a heat exchanger between incoming and exhaust air.
NZErationale: High coefficient of performance (COP), heat recovery of 35-95% of waste heat from cooling.

Air-source heat pump using heat recovery either:

name: Central inverter heat pump
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Air‐to‐air heat pump,Central inverter heat pump
description: Air-to-air cold climate heat pump with supreme heating output - capability of 100% heating output at -20 °C.
NZErationale: Cold climate heat pumps are an alternative to fossil-fuel boilers in areas of low or medium density, bringing significant energy saving opportunities and the possibility to phase out coal, oil and gas use in buildings.

name: Membrane heat pump
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Air‐to‐air heat pump,Membrane heat pump
description: Providing cooling and dehumidification (or humidification and heating), membrane heat pumps are characterised by several permeable membranes and a vacuum pump. Separate control of sensible and latent heat.
NZErationale: Demonstrated energy efficiency ratio twice market average for vapour compression systems, low pressure system, water as working fluid.
text: Providing cooling and dehumidification (or humidification and heating), membrane heat pumps are characterised by several permeable membranes and a vacuum pump. Separate control of sensible and latent heat. Demonstrated energy efficiency ratio twice market average for vapour compression systems, low pressure system, water as working fluid.

name: State-of-the-art air-to-air heat pump
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Air‐to‐air heat pump,State-of-the-art air-to-air heat pump
description: Transfer heat energy from a colder space to a warmer one, providing either heating or cooling (using either outdoor air or indoor air as a source of heat) thanks to vapour compression refrigeration and a refrigerant system. Typically more efficient than electrical resistance heaters, although efficiencies begin dropping significantly with low outside air temperature (below 5°C).
NZErationale: Large potential for deployment, driven by rising cooling demand. Possibility to exploit synergies with various thermal needs (heating, cooling), and benefit from technology spillovers.

name: Vapour compression packaged air conditioners
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Air‐to‐air heat pump,Vapour compression packaged air conditioners
description: Uses vapour compression refrigeration and a refrigerant system to remove heat from a space and provide cooling. All components (evaporator coil, condenser, and compressor) are located in one cabinet, usually placed outside.
NZErationale: Large potential for deployment, driven by rising cooling demand. Possibility to exploit synergies with various thermal needs (heating, cooling), and benefit from technology spillovers. Generally lower efficiencies compared with split air conditioners.

name: Vapour compression split air conditioners
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Air‐to‐air heat pump,Vapour compression split air conditioners
description: Uses vapour compression refrigeration and a refrigerant system to remove heat from a space and provide cooling. Components are split between an outdoor cabinet (condenser and compressor), and indoor cabinet (evaporator coil) and an air handler, which sends the cool air through the duct system.
NZErationale: Large potential for deployment, driven by rising cooling demand. Possibility to exploit synergies with various thermal needs (heating, cooling), and benefit from technology spillovers.

name: Cold climate air-source heat pump
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Air‐to‐water heat pump,Cold climate air-source heat pump
description: Heat pumps whose seasonal performance factor remains above 2.5-3 while operating several days in the year at temperatures lower than -10 °C, and which could withstand -25 °C. Cold-climate heat pumps minimise losses of heating capacity as outdoor temperatures drop through the adoption of two new scroll compressors working in parallel and/or adoption of a mix of refrigerants with thermophysical properties.
NZErationale: Cold climate heat pumps are an alternative to fossil-fuel boilers in areas of low or medium density, bringing significant energy saving opportunities and the possibility to phase out coal, oil and gas use in buildings.

name: Heat pumps with hydrocarbon refrigerant
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Air‐to‐water heat pump,Heat pumps with hydrocarbon refrigerant
description: Heat pump transferring heat from the outside air to a water circuit and/or tank, using hydrocarbon such as propane as a refrigerant.
NZErationale: Many heat pumps use F-gases as refrigerants, which high GWP and other environmental impact if leaked. Replacing F-gases with propane reduces impact on climante and environment considerably

name: Natural refrigerant heat pump water heaters
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Air‐to‐water heat pump,Natural refrigerant heat pump water heaters
description: Heat pump water heaters using a natural refrigerant, such as CO2, propane gas or ammonia (whose global warming potential can be more than 1000 times lower than conventional refrigerants such as R134a or R410a). For heat pump CO2 water heaters, the refrigerant operates in a transcritical cycle (i.e. behaving like a gas but with the density of a liquid), which enhances energy performance.
NZErationale: Up to 25-50% energy benefits compared to current code-compliant ones, refrigerant with low global warming potential. CO2 in particular is none-ozone depleting, non-flammable and has a low toxicity per the ISO 817 definition.

name: Inclined or deep horizontal wells heat pump
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Ground-source heat pump,Inclined or deep horizontal wells heat pump
description: Closed star-shaped geo-energy inclined exchangers (vertical, deviated or deep horizontal), typically going several hundred metres deep and allowing a drastic reduction of the space footprint of geothermal heating.
NZErationale:
Similar (very high) performance to a standard ground-source heat pump, but fully scalable and applicable to many building types, including for retrofit applications in urban environments.
Applicable for light industry.

name: Shallow ground-source heat pump
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Ground-source heat pump,Shallow ground-source heat pump
description: Heat pump transferring heat to or from the ground to provide cooling or heating, thanks to a ground heat exchanger buried in the ground. More energy-efficient than air-source heat pumps, especially in winter, as the underground temperature does not drop as much as other heat sources like the air or water.
NZErationale: Very high performance relative to air-to-air heat pumps, especially in very cold climates where peak heating demand during the winter season can be an issue.

description: Heat pump driven by thermal energy (delivered by steam or by combustion of natural gas), instead of being driven by electric energy (for mechanical heat pumps). Based on absorption (with a liquid absorption medium) and evaporation of a refrigerant.
NZErationale: Lower efficiencies compared to electric heat pumps, but greater than traditional gas boilers; they can be fuelled by biogas and can integrate solar, geothermal or other heat sources.

name: Vuilleumier heat pump
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Thermally-driven heat pump,Vuilleumier heat pump
description: Thermally driven machine that cyclically compresses and expands a gas between different volumes. It includes both a heat engine and a heat pump.
NZErationale: Coefficient of performance (COP) estimated for heating as 1.6, can potentially work with hydrogen. Helium is used as working fluid.

name: Thermo-acoustic heat pump
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Heat pumps,Thermo-acoustic heat pump
description: Thermoacoustic heat pumps work by using an acoustic pressure wave to disburse heating or cooling effects, and generally feature a stack, resonator and heat exchangers. Two recent examples are the Equium heat pump, which rather than a compressor uses a patented sound generator at its core, and BlueHeart Energy, which works with two pistons that oscillate at a frequency of 100 Hz in a closed pressure vessel filled with 50 bar helium. Thermoacoustic heat pumps can reportedly reach higher or lower temperatures than conventional heat pumps, and do not require refrigerants.
NZErationale: The thermoacoustic heat pump is a significantly smaller unit with excellent modulating capability and temperature flexibility, and does not require refrigerants.
text: Thermoacoustic heat pumps work by using an acoustic pressure wave to disburse heating or cooling effects, and generally feature a stack, resonator and heat exchangers. Two recent examples are the Equium heat pump, which rather than a compressor uses a patented sound generator at its core, and BlueHeart Energy, which works with two pistons that oscillate at a frequency of 100 Hz in a closed pressure vessel filled with 50 bar helium. Thermoacoustic heat pumps can reportedly reach higher or lower temperatures than conventional heat pumps, and do not require refrigerants.  The thermoacoustic heat pump is a significantly smaller unit with excellent modulating capability and temperature flexibility, and does not require refrigerants.

name: Barocaloric cooling
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Solid-state equipment cooling,Barocaloric cooling
description: Solid state cooling alternative to vapour compression technologies.  Applying an external field (pressure field) under adiabatic conditions leads to temperature increase of the caloric material which correspond to a change of volume. On the contrary, when decreasing adiabatically the external fields, the temperature of the material decreases to lower values compared to the initial one. The barocaloric effect is coupled with other calorific effects manifesting in the same material (multicaloric effect).
NZErationale: Many alternatives are less environmental friendly. Barocaloric solid refrigerants can achieve the same thermal performance as gaseous refrigerants. This is two orders of magnitude higher than any other solids. While best magnetocaloric materials only achieve a 3-degree temperature lift, barocaloric materials alone achieve 40-50 degrees.
text: Solid state cooling alternative to vapour compression technologies.  Applying an external field (pressure field) under adiabatic conditions leads to temperature increase of the caloric material which correspond to a change of volume. On the contrary, when decreasing adiabatically the external fields, the temperature of the material decreases to lower values compared to the initial one. The barocaloric effect is coupled with other calorific effects manifesting in the same material (multicaloric effect). Many alternatives are less environmental friendly. Barocaloric solid refrigerants can achieve the same thermal performance as gaseous refrigerants. This is two orders of magnitude higher than any other solids. While best magnetocaloric materials only achieve a 3-degree temperature lift, barocaloric materials alone achieve 40-50 degrees.

name: Elastocaloric cooling
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Solid-state equipment cooling,Elastocaloric cooling
description: Solid state cooling alternative to vapour compression technologies. Applying an external field (mechanical stress) under adiabatic conditions leads to temperature increase of the caloric material which correspond to a change of pressure. On the contrary, when decreasing adiabatically the external fields, the temperature of the material decreases to lower values compared to the initial one. It exploits the properties of shape-memory alloys to absorb or release heat from its surroundings.
NZErationale: Many alternatives are less environmental friendly, moderate costs and elevated energy density (over 100J/cm3), projected coefficient of performance (COP) of 6 in HVAC applications.
text: Solid state cooling alternative to vapour compression technologies. Applying an external field (mechanical stress) under adiabatic conditions leads to temperature increase of the caloric material which correspond to a change of pressure. On the contrary, when decreasing adiabatically the external fields, the temperature of the material decreases to lower values compared to the initial one. It exploits the properties of shape-memory alloys to absorb or release heat from its surroundings. Many alternatives are less environmental friendly, moderate costs and elevated energy density (over 100J/cm3), projected coefficient of performance (COP) of 6 in HVAC applications.

name: Electrocaloric cooling
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Solid-state equipment cooling,Electrocaloric cooling
description: Solid state cooling alternative to vapour compression technologies. Applying an external field (electric field) under adiabatic conditions leads to temperature increase of the caloric material which corresponds to a change of polarisation. Conversely, when decreasing adiabatically the external fields, the temperature of the material decreases to lower values compared to the initial one.
NZErationale: Many alternatives are less environmental friendly. Compared to magnetocaloric technologies, the electric fields required can be supplied more easily compared with magnetic fields, with higher power densities and compactness. While material efficiency is high and the cycle is thermodynamically reversible, the cycle is not yet suitable for heating and cooling applications.
text: Solid state cooling alternative to vapour compression technologies. name: Magnetocaloric cooling
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Solid-state equipment cooling,Magnetocaloric cooling
description: Solid state cooling alternative to vapour compression technologies. Applying an external field (magnetic fields) under adiabatic conditions leads to temperature increase of the caloric material which correspond to a change of magnetisation. On the contrary, when decreasing adiabatically the external fields, the temperature of the material decreases to lower values compared to the initial one. It exploits the properties of ferromagnetic materials to absorb or release heat from its surroundings.
NZErationale: Estimated efficiency 25% higher compared to best available cooling technologies. Magnetocaloric is the most mature solid state technology, however, there are still limitations in permanent magnet applications.
text: Solid state cooling alternative to vapour compression technologies. name: Standalone liquid or solid desiccant cooling
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Standalone liquid or solid desiccant cooling
description: Used to pre-cool the environment recovering both latent and sensible heat. Integrated piece of equipment to be coupled with air conditioners or evaporative coolers. Uses both electrical and thermal energy.
NZErationale: Reduction of ventilation loads up to 75% and of chiller capacity up to 25%.
text: Used to pre-cool the environment recovering both latent and sensible heat. Integrated piece of equipment to be coupled with air conditioners or evaporative coolers. Uses both electrical and thermal energy. Reduction of ventilation loads up to 75% and of chiller capacity up to 25%.

name: Trigeneration
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Generation,Trigeneration
description: Trigeneration systems produce heating, cooling and electricity.
NZErationale: On-site production of heat and electricity.
text: Trigeneration systems produce heating, cooling and electricity. On-site production of heat and electricity.

name: Active latent heat storage
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Active latent heat storage
description: Thermal storage system integrating heat transfer components into the storage volume, thus allowing more independence between the equipment energy capacity (i.e. total amount of energy that can be stored) and power (i.e. the amount of energy that could be discharged in a given unit of time).
NZErationale: As capacity and power can be chosen independently, active storage systems could be suitable in various applications and designed more optimally than traditional thermal storage systems.
text: Thermal storage system integrating heat transfer components into the storage volume, thus allowing more independence between the equipment energy capacity (i.e. total amount of energy that can be stored) and power (i.e. the amount of energy that could be discharged in a given unit of time). As capacity and power can be chosen independently, active storage systems could be suitable in various applications and designed more optimally than traditional thermal storage systems.

name: Combined latent and sensible storage system
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Combined latent and sensible storage system
description: Thermal storage system combining a phase-change material encapsulated into a high thermal capacity medium (e.g. concrete). Today, the coupling of multiple storage media could enhance storage density by a factor of two to three.
NZErationale: Combined latent and sensible storage systems could meet the flexibility needs of thermal and electrical grids at a lower cost than latent or sensible storage units.
text: Thermal storage system combining a phase-change material encapsulated into a high thermal capacity medium (e.g. concrete). Today, the coupling of multiple storage media could enhance storage density by a factor of two to three. Combined latent and sensible storage systems could meet the flexibility needs of thermal and electrical grids at a lower cost than latent or sensible storage units.

name: Liquid-gaseous thermal storage
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Latent (phase change material),Liquid-gaseous thermal storage
description: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the phase of a material from the liquid state to the gaseous state.
NZErationale: Considered too complex because of the important change of volume between liquid and gas (or high pressure).
text: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the phase of a material from the liquid state to the gaseous state. Considered too complex because of the important change of volume between liquid and gas (or high pressure).

name: Solid-liquid aqueous salt solutions thermal storage
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Latent (phase change material),Solid-liquid aqueous salt solutions thermal storage
description: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the phase of a material from the solid state to the liquid state. Such systems would be used for temperatures below 0 °C.
NZErationale: Available in a wide temperature range, low overcooling, recyclable, good compatibility with other materials but flammable and with a low thermal conductivity.
text: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the phase of a material from the solid state to the liquid state. name: Solid-liquid fatty acids thermal storage
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Latent (phase change material),Solid-liquid fatty acids thermal storage
description: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the phase of a material from the solid state to the liquid state. Such systems would be used for temperatures between 15 and 70 °C.
NZErationale: Biodegradable, non-corrosive and non-toxic, but limited material availability and latent heat lower compared to other alternatives such as alkanes.
text: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the phase of a material from the solid state to the liquid state. name: Solid-liquid ice storage
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Latent (phase change material),Solid-liquid ice storage
description: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the phase of a material from the solid state to the liquid state. Such systems would be used for a temperature of 0 °C. Water acts as the phase change material.
NZErationale: This solution can exploit renewables, reducing peak power needs for cooling or industrial processes.  Thermal energy is stored as ice and used later to maintain temperatures within a building or industrial process. The waste heat generally discarded by the refrigeration process can be used for space heating and hot water. Cheaper compared to batteries.

name: Solid-liquid low temperature heat
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Latent (phase change material),Solid-liquid low temperature heat
description: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the phase of a material from the solid state to the liquid state.
NZErationale: More dense than sensible heat storage; isothermal; some materials are cheap and abundant, non-toxic materials but many materials are flammable or corrosive; phase separation may occur.

sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Latent (phase change material),Solid-liquid salt hydrates and paraffins thermal storage

NZErationale: Available in a wide temperature range, low overcooling, recyclable, good compatibility with other materials but flammable and with a low thermal conductivity.

name: Solid-liquid salt thermal storage
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Latent (phase change material),Solid-liquid salt thermal storage
description: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the phase of a material from the solid state to the liquid state. Such systems would be used for temperatures above 200 °C.
NZErationale:
Have good thermal conductivity compared to organic materials, small subcooling up to several K,
and low vapour pressure, good chemical stability (except for carbonates and nitrates). However, they have large volume changes and are corrosive
to metals.

name: Solid-liquid sugar alcohols thermal storage
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Latent (phase change material),Solid-liquid sugar alcohols thermal storage
description: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the phase of a material from the solid state to the liquid state. Such systems would be used for temperatures between 90 and 200 °C.
NZErationale: High densities lead to high heat of fusion per mass and high heat of fusion per volume; safe and non-toxic, but show some subcooling effect.

name: Solid-solid thermal storage
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Latent (phase change material),Solid-solid thermal storage
description: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the crystalline structure of a solid material.
NZErationale: Quite slow compared to liquid-solid. A large range of materials make this method available for temperature ranging from -100 °C to 1 000 °C.
text: Heat is stored and released at constant temperature thanks to a change in the crystalline structure of a solid material. Quite slow compared to liquid-solid. A large range of materials make this method available for temperature ranging from -100 °C to 1 000 °C.

name: Chilled water storage
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Sensible,Chilled water storage
description: A chilled water storage system charges cold water thanks to an air/water/ground-to-water conditioning unit when there is no congestion in the electricity grid. The system restores the cooling to the distribution system during peak period, thus reducing the peak load.
NZErationale: Synergies with electric grid, reduction in electricity spending for users, low initial investment cost.
text: A chilled water storage system charges cold water thanks to an air/water/ground-to-water conditioning unit when there is no congestion in the electricity grid. The system restores the cooling to the distribution system during peak period, thus reducing the peak load. Synergies with electric grid, reduction in electricity spending for users, low initial investment cost.

name: Hot water tank
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Sensible,Hot water tank
description: A hot water tank stores sanitary hot water to meet household daily needs.
NZErationale: Cheap, reliable, long lifetime, non-toxic materials but with low energy density and self discharge.
text: A hot water tank stores sanitary hot water to meet household daily needs. Cheap, reliable, long lifetime, non-toxic materials but with low energy density and self discharge.

name: Vacuum-insulated high-temperature water tank
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Sensible,Vacuum-insulated high-temperature water tank
description: Heat is produced through an electric resistance, the solid state storage media is vacuum-insulated, and the heat exchange to the 90 °C distribution system is embedded in the product. The system could be a cylinder of around 1m-large and 2m-high that can draw up to 20 kW of electrical power.
NZErationale: Safe, recyclable, 20-year lifetime, high thermal conductivity, heat storage losses <5%, potential to be less costly, but heavy (1.5 tonnes for domestic applications) and less efficient than heat pumps (as they use an electric resistance).

name: Shape-stabilised phase change material (ss-PCM)
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Shape-stabilised phase change material (ss-PCM)
description: Phase change materials are able to store energy through changing the physical state of a material from solid to liquid, and releasing it through solidification. They are therefore able to act as a passive thermal battery.
NZErationale: The new material is a shape-stabilised phase change material that can store up to five times more thermal energy than commercially available phase change materials.
text: Phase change materials are able to store energy through changing the physical state of a material from solid to liquid, and releasing it through solidification. They are therefore able to act as a passive thermal battery.  The new material is a shape-stabilised phase change material that can store up to five times more thermal energy than commercially available phase change materials.

name: Aquifer thermal energy storage (ATES)
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Underground thermal storage,Aquifer thermal energy storage (ATES)
description: An open-loop geothermal network uses an aquifer to store cold or heat on a seasonal basis.
NZErationale: Seasonal storage is key to offset peak demand, which is generally driven by a building's thermal needs (either during the winter or summer). However, large scale systems need to be implemented at the community level (zero-emissions districts, campuses, etc).
text: An open-loop geothermal network uses an aquifer to store cold or heat on a seasonal basis. Seasonal storage is key to offset peak demand, which is generally driven by a building's thermal needs (either during the winter or summer). However, large scale systems need to be implemented at the community level (zero-emissions districts, campuses, etc).

name: Borehole thermal energy storage (BTES)
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermal storage,Underground thermal storage,Borehole thermal energy storage (BTES)
description: A closed-loop geothermal network operates to store heat seasonally in the ground (while a conventional ground source heat pump dissipates heat or cold in the subsurface).
NZErationale: Seasonal storage is key to offset peak demand, which is generally driven by building's thermal needs (either during the winter or summer). However, large scale systems need to be implemented at the community level (zero-emissions districts, campuses, etc).

name: Thermo-chemical storage
sector: Demand,Buildings,Heating and cooling,Storage,Thermo-chemical storage
description: Storage device based on reversible chemical reaction which allows heat adsorptions. Thermal energy is used to dissociate compounds (“AB”) into two reaction products (“A” and “B”). Upon subsequent recombination of the reactants, an exothermic reverse reaction occurs and the previously-stored heat of reaction is released. A reverse reaction results in heat release. This allows for the theoretically loss-less storage of thermal energy.
NZErationale: Promising way to store heat for residential buildings, with high mass transfer, fast reaction time and low cost.

name: Advanced lighting control system
sector: Demand,Buildings,Lighting,Advanced lighting control system
description: Advanced daylighting systems include a wide variety of controls to optimise the use of LED systems by avoiding their use when it is not necessary. They are also able to adjust electrical input depending on natural daylight.
NZErationale: LEDs whose power can adjust to natural daylight and turn off when nobody is in a room will help reduce electricity use for lighting (by 20 to 40% depending on people's behaviour, building usage, etc).
text: Advanced daylighting systems include a wide variety of controls to optimise the use of LED systems by avoiding their use when it is not necessary. They are also able to adjust electrical input depending on natural daylight. LEDs whose power can adjust to natural daylight and turn off when nobody is in a room will help reduce electricity use for lighting (by 20 to 40% depending on people's behaviour, building usage, etc).

name: Direct current lighting
sector: Demand,Buildings,Lighting,Direct current lighting
description: Direct current lighting refers to light-emitting diodes (LED) run on direct current (DC) and able to be connected directly to a DC grid to avoid the AC/DC conversion required with the traditional AC grid.
NZErationale: Possibility to link them directly to PV systems.
text: Direct current lighting refers to light-emitting diodes (LED) run on direct current (DC) and able to be connected directly to a DC grid to avoid the AC/DC conversion required with the traditional AC grid. Possibility to link them directly to PV systems.

name: Conventional LED
sector: Demand,Buildings,Lighting,Lamps and luminaires,Conventional LED
description: Light-emitting diodes (LED) use solid state technology to produce a directional and monochromatic light at very high efficiency and long lifetimes compared to traditional incandescent or compact fluorescent light bulbs. To create white light, LED can either use phosphor conversion or (red, green and blue) RGB systems.
NZErationale: High efficiency and long lifetime compared to alternative lighting, and already starting to be cost-competitive with traditional lighting.
text: Light-emitting diodes (LED) use solid state technology to produce a directional and monochromatic light at very high efficiency and long lifetimes compared to traditional incandescent or compact fluorescent light bulbs. To create white light, LED can either use phosphor conversion or (red, green and blue) RGB systems. High efficiency and long lifetime compared to alternative lighting, and already starting to be cost-competitive with traditional lighting.

name: Organic LED
sector: Demand,Buildings,Lighting,Lamps and luminaires,Organic LED
description: Organic light-emitting diodes (OLED) are a solid state technology that produce a diffuse light source at high efficiency, making them ideal for use in lighting and displays. They can also be produced on flexible substrates, allowing incorporation into furniture and architecture. There are two types of OLEDs, small-molecular and polymer (PLED). The majority of OLEDs today use the small-molecular subtype.
NZErationale: High efficiency and long lifetime compared to alternative lighting.
text: Organic light-emitting diodes (OLED) are a solid state technology that produce a diffuse light source at high efficiency, making them ideal for use in lighting and displays. They can also be produced on flexible substrates, allowing incorporation into furniture and architecture. There are two types of OLEDs, small-molecular and polymer (PLED). The majority of OLEDs today use the small-molecular subtype. High efficiency and long lifetime compared to alternative lighting.

name: Polymer LED
sector: Demand,Buildings,Lighting,Lamps and luminaires,Polymer LED
description: Polymer light-emitting diode (PLED) is a type of OLED, using large molecules (polymers) typically deposited using a solution-based method (e.g. inkjet printing or screen printing) which is cheaper than high-vacuum evaporation used for small-molecular OLEDs, but comes at the expense of lifetime and efficiency.
NZErationale: High efficiency and long lifetime compared to alternative lighting.
text: Polymer light-emitting diode (PLED) is a type of OLED, using large molecules (polymers) typically deposited using a solution-based method (e.g. inkjet printing or screen printing) which is cheaper than high-vacuum evaporation used for small-molecular OLEDs, but comes at the expense of lifetime and efficiency. High efficiency and long lifetime compared to alternative lighting.

name: Gamification devices
sector: Demand,Buildings,Systems integration in buildings,Demand response,Gamification devices
description: Using game elements and game design techniques, gamification aims to improve customer participation in demand management programmes (e.g. demand response, energy efficiency), by competing or collaborating with others and improving upon past performance.
NZErationale: Thermal comfort tailored to consumer's need.
text: Using game elements and game design techniques, gamification aims to improve customer participation in demand management programmes (e.g. demand response, energy efficiency), by competing or collaborating with others and improving upon past performance. Thermal comfort tailored to consumer's need.

name: Interval-Time of use meter
sector: Demand,Buildings,Systems integration in buildings,Demand response,Interval-Time of use meter
description: Switch connected to an electricity meter turning on in periods of off-peak tariffs (under a time-of-use (TOU) pricing scheme).
NZErationale: Time of Use (TOU) tariffs (static in many cases) give an incentive for customers to shift their load to off-peak hours. Devices such as storage heaters or water heaters can be connected to the meter to automatically turn on/off, reducing peak demand and reducing electricity bills for consumers.
text: Switch connected to an electricity meter turning on in periods of off-peak tariffs (under a time-of-use (TOU) pricing scheme). Time of Use (TOU) tariffs (static in many cases) give an incentive for customers to shift their load to off-peak hours. Devices such as storage heaters or water heaters can be connected to the meter to automatically turn on/off, reducing peak demand and reducing electricity bills for consumers.

name: Open automated demand response
sector: Demand,Buildings,Systems integration in buildings,Demand response,Open automated demand response
description: Open automated demand response is a method for a dispatcher to continuously broadcast a demand-response signal to a customer which facilitates a timely and predictable response from the system operator while allowing choices by the consumer.
NZErationale: Automation is key for building loads to react promptly to wholesale and retail market distortions, helping to maintain grid stability and low prices for everyone.
text: Open automated demand response is a method for a dispatcher to continuously broadcast a demand-response signal to a customer which facilitates a timely and predictable response from the system operator while allowing choices by the consumer. Automation is key for building loads to react promptly to wholesale and retail market distortions, helping to maintain grid stability and low prices for everyone.

name: Smart meter
sector: Demand,Buildings,Systems integration in buildings,Demand response,Smart meter
description: Smart meters are electronic devices that record electricity consumption on a hourly basis or more frequently, and report at least daily to utilities. Smart meters are capable of two-way communication, sending time-based pricing information toward the home or demand response commands to devices.
NZErationale: Smart meters can facilitate more dynamic demand response through a number of load control mechanisms, e.g. sending real-time prices to smart appliances and switching on/off some devices.
text: Smart meters are electronic devices that record electricity consumption on a hourly basis or more frequently, and report at least daily to utilities. Smart meters are capable of two-way communication, sending time-based pricing information toward the home or demand response commands to devices. Smart meters can facilitate more dynamic demand response through a number of load control mechanisms, e.g. sending real-time prices to smart appliances and switching on/off some devices.

name: Virtual net metering - community scale solar
sector: Demand,Buildings,Systems integration in buildings,Demand response,Virtual net metering - community scale solar
description: Virtual net metering (VNM) is a bill crediting system in which solar is not used on-site but is instead externally installed and shared among subscribers. In this case, subscribers receive credits on their electricity bill for excess energy produced. Community solar is an alternative to rooftop solar wherein homeowners collectively pay for a solar system that provides power to multiple households.
NZErationale: As 40% of solar PV capacity will be on rooftops in 2070, community-scale solar offers a solution for homeowners that do not qualify (or are not willing) to have solar panels on their roofs.
text: Virtual net metering (VNM) is a bill crediting system in which solar is not used on-site but is instead externally installed and shared among subscribers. In this case, subscribers receive credits on their electricity bill for excess energy produced. Community solar is an alternative to rooftop solar wherein homeowners collectively pay for a solar system that provides power to multiple households. name: Electrical storage for building systems integration
sector: Demand,Buildings,Systems integration in buildings,Electrical storage for building systems integration
description: Batteries (solid state battery, lithium-ion battery, redox flow battery) are electrochemical devices that can store or discharge electrical energy.
NZErationale: Low applicability in the buildings sector given conversion losses. Other types of storage are generally cheaper and more promising given building energy needs. However, battery storage can be applied in buildings using battery electric vehicles in vehicle-to-grid mode.
text: Batteries (solid state battery, lithium-ion battery, redox flow battery) are electrochemical devices that can store or discharge electrical energy.  Low applicability in the buildings sector given conversion losses. Other types of storage are generally cheaper and more promising given building energy needs. However, battery storage can be applied in buildings using battery electric vehicles in vehicle-to-grid mode.

name: Direct current buildings system
sector: Demand,Buildings,Systems integration in buildings,Grid interaction,Direct current buildings system
description: Direct Current (DC) Microgrids combine DC power generation from photovoltaic (PV) sources with battery energy storage and can directly power adapted DC loads (e.g. EV charging, lighting, HVAC) without DC/AC conversion, thus making efficiency gains. With additional AC/DC convertors, they can be connected to the grid and/or power common AC loads.
NZErationale: As the conversion from direct current (produced by PV cells) to alternating current (to transport electricity on a long-distance) generates a loss of 4-8%, and that alternating current needs to be converted back to direct current to power appliances, 100% DC systems are a source of efficiency gains, under the assumptions that electricity is produced and consumed locally in microgrids to avoid transport losses.
text: Direct Current (DC) Microgrids combine DC power generation from photovoltaic (PV) sources with battery energy storage and can directly power adapted DC loads (e.g. EV charging, lighting, HVAC) without DC/AC conversion, thus making efficiency gains. With additional AC/DC convertors, they can be connected to the grid and/or power common AC loads. As the conversion from direct current (produced by PV cells) to alternating current (to transport electricity on a long-distance) generates a loss of 4-8%, and that alternating current needs to be converted back to direct current to power appliances, 100% DC systems are a source of efficiency gains, under the assumptions that electricity is produced and consumed locally in microgrids to avoid transport losses.

name: Double smart grid
sector: Demand,Buildings,Systems integration in buildings,Grid interaction,Double smart grid
description: A double smart grid integrates a smart electricity and district energy network to fully exploit synergies among energy loads (e.g. especially for electricity, heating and cooling needs) and integrate a wide variety of renewable (e.g. PV, solar thermal, Power-to-Heat) or waste energy resources.
NZErationale: Enhanced system efficiency, easily scalable and applicable to many dense, mix-use districts.
text: A double smart grid integrates a smart electricity and district energy network to fully exploit synergies among energy loads (e.g. especially for electricity, heating and cooling needs) and integrate a wide variety of renewable (e.g. PV, solar thermal, Power-to-Heat) or waste energy resources. Enhanced system efficiency, easily scalable and applicable to many dense, mix-use districts.

name: Electrification of high-temperature heat for ancillary processes
sector: Demand,Industry,Aluminium,Manufacturing,Electrification of high-temperature heat for ancillary processes
description: Electricity can be used to provide high temperature heat for ancillary processes in aluminium manufacturing, such as using plasma torches for as a heating source in cast houses' finishing processes (ex. rolling).
NZErationale: Ancillary processes are not major energy and emissions sources.
text: Electricity can be used to provide high temperature heat for ancillary processes in aluminium manufacturing, such as using plasma torches for as a heating source in cast houses' finishing processes (ex. rolling). Ancillary processes are not major energy and emissions sources.

name: Hydrogen for high-temperature heat for ancillary processes and secondary production
sector: Demand,Industry,Aluminium,Manufacturing,Hydrogen for high-temperature heat for ancillary processes and secondary production
description: Hydrogen can be used to provide high temperature heat for ancillary processes in aluminium manufacturing, such as finishing processes (ex. rolling), or heat treatment of aluminium and alloys.
NZErationale: Ancillary processes are not major energy and emissions sources.
text: Hydrogen can be used to provide high temperature heat for ancillary processes in aluminium manufacturing, such as finishing processes (ex. rolling), or heat treatment of aluminium and alloys. Ancillary processes are not major energy and emissions sources.

name: Reducing metal forming losses and lightweighting through additive manufacturing
sector: Demand,Industry,Aluminium,Manufacturing,Reducing metal forming losses and lightweighting through additive manufacturing
description: Reducing yield losses in manufacturing (e.g. sheet metal in the automotive industry) would reduce material demand and, in turn, emissions from material production. Additive manufacturing, a digitalised production process in which three-dimensional objects are produced by successively adding material by layer, can help. By its nature it leads to minimal material losses compared to processes that cut an object from larger pieces of material. It also facilitates design of lighter-weight parts.
NZErationale: Manufacturing yields are already quite high for many manufactured products, although improvements could be helpful in applications with high losses currently, such as vehicles. While improvements can help reduce material use and thus emissions, the impact on total emissions is relatively low given that collection rates for pre-consumer scrap are high, the quality of the scrap is high (due to good sorting) and recycled production emits a relatively small fraction of the emissions of primary production. Improvements in terms of additional potential for lightweighting, on the other hand, can reduce total demand and thus help contribute to emissions reductions.

name: Concentrated solar thermal in the Bayer process
sector: Demand,Industry,Aluminium,Production,Alumina refining,Concentrated solar thermal in the Bayer process
description: The Bayer process - the main method to refine bauxite into alumina (the input to aluminium smelting) - requires 100 to 250 °C heat and steam for digestion and 1000 °C heat for calcination, which are currently delivered using fossil fuels. Testing is underway to use concentrated solar thermal as heat input into alumina refining.
NZErationale: Alternative fuels provide a good prospect for reducing alumina refining emissions. Alumina refining is a key source of the sector's emissions, so it will be important to develop technologies to reduce them in moving towards net zero emissions. Concentrated solar thermal potentially has lower applicability compared to alternatives.

name: Electricity in the Bayer process
sector: Demand,Industry,Aluminium,Production,Alumina refining,Electricity in the Bayer process
description: The Bayer process - the main method to refine bauxite into alumina (the input to aluminium smelting) - requires 100 to 250 °C heat and steam for digestion and 1000 °C heat for calcination, which are currently delivered using fossil fuels. Testing is underway to use electricity for both digestion heat (e.g. boilers/co-generation) and for calcination.
NZErationale: Alternative fuels provide a good prospect for reducing alumina refining emissions. Alumina refining is a key source of the sector's emissions, so it will be important to develop technologies to reduce them in moving towards net zero emissions. Electrification is the most developed technology being deployed at the moment, so likely has the largest relevance for net zero.

name: High share of biomass fuel in the Bayer process
sector: Demand,Industry,Aluminium,Production,Alumina refining,High share of biomass fuel in the Bayer process

For the scale of Alumina refining, biomass potentially has lower applicability than other heat sources.

name: Integration of heat exchangers to vary energy consumption and production levels
sector: Demand,Industry,Aluminium,Production,Integration of heat exchangers to vary energy consumption and production levels
description: This technology uses heat exchangers to control the heat loss of aluminium smelting pots and vary production levels, thus enabling increased or decreased electricity consumption by 25% for up to several hours at a given time, without adverse impacts on the production process. Thus, the smelter could increase power consumption at times when demand and prices are low, effectively 'storing' electricity in molten aluminium so that electricity consumption can be reduced at times of high demand and prices. This would help with managing the power grid's demand and supply fluctuations, particularly as increasing amounts of variable renewable energy are added to the grid.
NZErationale: The technology can power demand response services to the grid, assisting with renewable energy integration. This could help reduce costs and improve reliability for the power system. However, it does not directly result in emissions reduction.
